description: Tour Guys began operating free or "tip-what-you-feel" tours in Toronto and Vancouver in 2009, and have since expanded into other cities and offer tours for school groups, corporate clients, conference attendees, and travellers of all kinds.

reviews.title: Great Interesting Tour, as a leisurely pace.
text: I really enjoyed this tour. There were only 5 of us on it and the guide was very knowledgeable and interesting. Although it was a long time 90 minutes plus, it wasn't too far to walk and at a leisurely pace. We often found a wall to sit on to save the back as well. My husband felt some of the guides opinions a little erroneous but I didn't. We did feel that although we had a couple of hangers on, that wasn't a problem but there were times when one of them occupied the guides time too much and we were left waiting for the guide to finish talking to her. I would have liked her to wait until we had completed our tour to answer her questions.

reviews.title: Unreliable liars.
text: Tour guide didn‚Äôt show up.  5 people (3 different groups) were screwed out of the tour.
Almost impossible to find a number or contact to discuss it with.
When we finally got someone on the phone, they accused us of being there late and missing the guide.  Not true as we were there 30 minutes early.
They finally found the guide at home as he ‚Äúforgot‚Äù.

reviews.title: Highly Recommend - From 2 Australians
text: We had Kiran as our tour guide (I hope I spelt that right) and when my Mother and I first arrived at Toronto, we honestly hated it. It's a confronting change from being at home and we felt very uneasy as two women. We arrived at our tour with Kiran in a group of 9 on a whim for something to do and he talked about the homeless population of Toronto, what it's like to live here and showed us some incredibly interesting things. All while doing so he made sure we were all safe and answered absolutely any questions we had and was absolutely hilarious to listen to and made sure to liven things up with jokes when the stories got a little dark. He also had a personalised list of the best places to eat in Toronto which he gave out at the end. It definitely helped lift our view on Toronto and we wish we had done it on our first day here. Thank you.

reviews.title: Great Tour!  I would use them again!
text: Jackie took us on a great walk around the historical area of Toronto.  She was knowledgeable and entertaining.  We did it on our first day in the city and it gave us a good understanding of this part of Toronto.  She arrived about 5-10 minutes before tour was to begin and we had about 10-12 people on our trip...people from Canada, USA and Europe.

reviews.title: Maybe take a different tour?
text: The guide didn't seem especially familiar with the history of Toronto except a bit at the "points of interest" on the tour.  The whole tour seemed a bit like grasping at straws since so few struuctures remain standing,  especially with this guide. As a heads up, like many city centers, the touring areas are not especially nice and you'll see people in hardship.

reviews.title: The bad outweighed the good, unfortunately.
text: Jennifer, our tour guide said she was a last minute replacement. After asking about each person in our group, she said she was from Toronto. Her original enthusiasm in talking about the old town buildings and history turned as she took pains to point out the historic and current ineptness/corruption of city and provincial governments. Not sure why, as no one in the group was able to bring about a change here.

We were taken to an area near Holy Trinity through a tent city. While passing by  an alcove, a young man lying prostrate appeared to have shallow breathing, and gray blue coloring. When told to our guide, we were turned back to see CPR being administered and ambulance arrival. Our guide commented, ‚Äúsee our government doesn‚Äôt care‚Äù. Our son left the tour at this point.

This was shocking enough, then we pressed on to the Yonge Street area. The history of this area seemed to carry a lot of protest marches and conflict. However, our guide proceeded to point out a building across the street and give a detailed and horrifying description of a young boy who was brutally killed and left on the roof the building indicated. With sick stomachs, we moved on to St. Lawrence Market. At that point we were reminded to tip our guide, which we paid to be released.

I'm sorry this turned out this way, as I have always trusted Trip Advisor for it's great city tours. We did go back to see the Market, the Dog Park and the Flat Iron Building before leaving town. However, I now have no desire to return to Toronto.

reviews.title: Great tour in Toronto!!!
text: Michelle was a great tour guide. Very knowledgeable and interesting!
Great way to learn the history of Toronto. Highly recommend!
Definitely deserved her tip!!

reviews.title: Interesting historical tour
text: Jennifer was a very good guide, informative and easy to understand. We really enjoyed seeing all of the historical buildings in downtown Toronto, and learning about their history and social aspects of the city. We would definitely recommend it.

reviews.title: Lovely walk. Learned a lot
text: We had an excellent time with Michael. I have a 7 year old history buff, and Michael was very kind in adding little bits that would be of interest to him. It was a great way to get to know the city!

reviews.title: The Old Toronto Tour will teach you something new
text: Our tour guide Jennifer was amazing from start to end. Her narration of Toronto's rich history is filled with enthusiastic story-telling. I love that she is able to provide us with so many historical, quirky, hidden and interesting facts about the city including dates and timelines. I also appreciated that she tied in past, present and future details about Toronto. She provided history as well and important socio-political information about the city. She was well informed and engaging and I highly encourage her for anyone who is a history buff. I left with so much new knowledge (and suggested readings and Toronto history to go home and read up on). I recommend this tour for tourists and locals alike as this was just as equally valuable and rewarding to me as a Toronto native as our guest visiting from abroad.

reviews.title: Great personal touch
text: Great personal approach to a walking tour! Thomas was knowledgeable and enthusiastic about Old Town Toronto!

reviews.title: Old Town walking tour
text: Kieran was insightful ,comprehensive explanations and humorous. An exceptional experience, much enlightenment about Toronto, thank you üòä

reviews.title: A Great Look Around Old Toronto
text: Friends recommended this tour for us. Have been to Toronto several times and enjoy walking the city. This Old Town Toronto History Tour with Kieran was excellent. He was knowledgeable and entertaining. The dark history information was incredible and moving forward in some areas pleasing. If you like walking cities this tour is a must.

reviews.title: Hilarious tour guide.
text: Did the old town tour with Kieran. He was a great laugh and really seemed engaged with everyone. I had no idea Toronto had such a unique history.

reviews.title: Great Street Art Tour!
text: The tour guide was amazing. Full of history and info about the art and the area. I would highly recommend this tour!

reviews.title: Great intro to some history and sights
text: I did the Villains tour with Neil and it was great. Very knowledgeable, friendly, and he obviously enjoyed touring. Should be more popular than it is. I suppose the benefit of it being a bit of a hidden gem is you end up getting a private tour for group tour money

reviews.title: Toronto history you never knew - made fun!
text: Heroes and Villains tour with guide Neil was fun and educational - we recommend it highly for individuals and groups, for both tourists and Torontonians alike!

reviews.title: Wonderful TO tour takes you back (then further back) in time
text: Jason was a wonderful guide‚Ä¶really knowledgeable, helpful and enthusiastic about his city, its history and architecture. He really brings this tour to life with genuine stories and descriptions of key figures and events involved in this fascinating  journey back in TO time. Would definitely do this tour again!

reviews.title: Kieran was great
text: Kieran was a great guide. He arrived early and when he overheard us talking he approached us to see if we were there for the tour. Kieran was funny, informative, and very approachable. It seemed like he made the time to chat to each group at some point as we walked between landmarks so no one felt left out. He was also open to answering questions anyone had along the way. I would definitely recommend him. He was great!

reviews.title: Would highly recommend
text: Jennifer was an amazing tour guide. We learned a lot about the history and politics of the area. She was incredibly animated and made the time fly by. Thank you

reviews.title: Canadian Heroes and Villains: A Must Do!!!
text: "Tour Guys can show you more in less time". That's exactly what happened. This particular tour is superbly planned out. Our guide Neil was an expert in all things Canadian history. We started at the Ontario Legislature through the lush Queen's Park and down University's Ave to stop and marvel at the many amazing sculptures and murals by Lea Vivot, Alexander Bacon and Walter Seymour Allward. The tour was educational, fun and entertaining. My mother-in-law and I really enjoyed Neil's sense of humour and his love for Canadian history. We learned lots and are already planning our next guided walking tour with Tour Guys. I highly recommend it :)

reviews.title: Canadian Heroes and Villains - a must see
text: This walking tour featured specific stories and facts about the sculptures around the Toronto Legislature and area. Our guide Neil was entertaining and informative. What a great way to learn more Canadian history. My daughter-in-law and I were impressed by the stories of heroes and villains recounted by Neil. We were surprised and delighted to see the Queen's jubilee garden, a recent sculpture of Queen Elizabeth II and a recent Memorial to many wars. We rate this a MUST SEE for anyone interested in the history of our country Canada. Bravo to Neil who added significant context to all the sights.

reviews.title: Wow -- Food Tour offers much more than just Food!
text: I took a group of graduate students from the University of Guelph on a food tour of Kensington Market and Chinatown.  The tour was soooo much more than food-- Jason shared insights into history, immigrant populations, diversity, culture-- while we ate our way through the neighbourhoods.  Highly recommend -- Jason was great to work with and it was easy to book.   I will definitely be back with another group and my family, too.

reviews.title: Heroes and Villians Tour Toronto
text: As a  birthday gift from my son, we were treated to the Tour Guys "Heroes and Villains Tour" of downtown Toronto, centred around Queen's Park (appropriate!) and hosted by Neil. He was excellent. We've lived most of our lives in Toronto and still learned new stories and discovered new places. The conversation was engaging and the delivery entertaining. Contemporary themes and context. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: great tour
text: great time of the history tour with Kieren! highly recommend it and a great price, lots of walking and interesting facts about toronto. thanks

reviews.title: Get some Toronto history and see gorgeous churches and other sights.
text: Got lucky! We visited on a national holiday, so just me and my teenage daughter got to tour the city with Kieran. Really enjoyed our guide‚Äôs stories and insights, and got a list of recommended restaurants and attractions at the end. Nice bonus!

One note: St. Lawrence market is closed on Mondays, and we were here on Monday. Bummer! Because that‚Äôs right where the tour ends. Try and book this a different day of the week, because the market would be a perfect next stop!

reviews.title: So-so experience, it was on time and he did his best
text: I want more depth or interesting nuances and felt those were lacking.  His walking pace was fine for us but difficult for him.  He doused his head in water on a "not hot day" and looked terrible.  I wouldn't go with that group again.

reviews.title: A great experience for a great price!
text: Robert was not your every day tour guide.  He travelled quite a bit and it was apparent that he was knowledgeable in world history and art.  He was able to connect news events with many of artist‚Äôs work in the alley.  This tour was interesting.  We will never look at graffiti the same again!

reviews.title: Great walking tour delving into some of Toronto's history
text: Great walking tour provided by Jennifer at an incredibly reasonable price. Started at Old City Hall and walked through various districts stopping at key buildings and churches to discover some of Toronto's history. Ended at St Lawrence Market, which is worth a visit itself to see all the fresh produce available. It's definitely worth the money and good to get a better understanding of the city's history.

reviews.title: Awesome graffiti tour in Toronto
text: I had a great time on the graffiti tour in Toronto with Jennifer. As someone with zero experience in graffiti, I wasn't sure what to expect on the tour. However, Jennifer‚Äôs engaging personality and welcoming approach makes it accessible to anyone, regardless of their prior knowledge of street art. She effortlessly shared her deep knowledge and passion for graffiti and street art, and shared insightful stories about the artists, their techniques, and the cultural significance of the pieces we encountered. Jennifer‚Äôs enthusiasm is infectious, and her insights added depth and meaning to every piece we encountered.
Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Great Way to Explore the City
text: We had Winnie as our tour guide and they were absolutely great! I loved that it wasn't just a tour that showed us the art and moved on. We got some history about Toronto mixed in with information about artists and about the street art scene in general which my friend and I had zero idea about before hand. Felt informative, fun, and was a great way to spend a bit of time exploring the city. Winnie was knowledgeable, friendly, and great to talk to as well! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Good history would have loved to have seen more!
text: We‚Äôre familiar with old town, having moved to Toronto, but we wanted to learn about the cities history. Information about the history of the city was interesting but we didn‚Äôt feel the tour route showed the best of the cities old town!

reviews.title: Kensington/Chinatown Walking Tour
text: Tour Guys created a private tour for us that included Kensington, Chinatown and the amazing graffiti in these areas.  Jackie was our guide‚Ä¶ she was extremely knowledgeable, and also included many personal stories that added so much more to our tour.  Tour Guys was great in helping us to determine what to include in our tour, providing various price options‚Ä¶ all to ensure it was something we would enjoy. Thanks to Kieran and Jackie!!

reviews.title: Fascinating walking tour !
text: Micheal our tour guide was amazing - his passion for the city came across and we found the whole experience fascinating and great fun ! Would recommend you book this walking tour if you can üëçüèº

reviews.title: Graffiti Alley
text: Great tour, Winnie was very knowledgeable and funny!  We walked through Graffiti Alley and Winnie pointed out works by different graffiti artists and tagged.

reviews.title: Great walking tour to explore the city
text: I'm from Toronto, but I decided to take this walking tour anyway because I think it's important to be a tourist in your city. This was a great tour and I was able to learn new things and see some places I've never seen before. I recommend it for locals and tourists. Luckily the weather was really nice and we were a small group of under 10 people which made it feel more intimate. Jackie was a great tour guide and I liked her sense of humour and the way she explained things.

reviews.title: Canadian History ... Fun to get to know my own city
text: I loved the Canadian Heroes of Villains: Lighter and Darker Sides of History, Eh? tour with Neil.

Neil led us on a wild and informative walk around Queen's park using existing statues and monuments that tell the story of Canadian history. It felt as though Neil knew the historical characters on his tour personally ‚Äì both their accomplishments and dark secrets.  Neil kept us entertained with many different tricks up his sleeve ! I won't give any surprises away here.
I recommend this tour to anyone from Toronto, and to visitors to Toronto alike.
I attended this tour by myself and it was fun to be in a small walking tour that allowed me to meet some other people.

reviews.title: Worst, I‚Äôve ever been on. And my mom.
text: We were scheduled for a two hour tour and the tour actually lasted three hours. This was supposed to have multiple stops at the market, which we never had time for. We are also supposed to stop and have a bite to eat at a local pub which we paid for, however according to Devon our tour guide, we didn‚Äôt have time to do that. We also stopped at a coffee shop to have coffee and I had to buy Devon‚Äôs coffee for us. We kept asking about the things and told them we were under the impression that the tour is only supposed to last for two hours yet it still lasted three and we didn‚Äôt get everything done. Very dissatisfied very disappointed.

reviews.title: Walking tour of Toronto's Graffiti Alley
text: An amazing 90 minute + tour by Kieran to our PROBUS group.   He introduced us to the  difference of street art vs graffiti art, the subculture and the meaning and purpose of the art and writing on the walls.   We were most impressed with the work of 1) Uber 5000 and the his small yellow birds appearing in many of his pieces, and Kevin Ludo's portrait of David Suzuki.   The tour of Kensington was also informative.   Providing us with the history of this neighbourhood and he introduced us to the King of Kensington in the way of a statue of Al Waxman and Kensington Market's garden car - our City's smallest park!
Highly recommend the Tour Guys fun and informative walking tours.

reviews.title: Neil is great!
text: Neil was a very engaging tour guide and we had a blast going on his walking tour with the amount of knowledge Neil had about Canadian history. I'm excited to dive deeper into the history right out our doorsteps in Toronto.
